enhanced_information: Herpes simplex encephalitis is primarily caused by the herpes simplex virus (HSV) and requires antiviral treatment. Acyclovir is the standard treatment for this condition, supported by strong clinical evidence. Vidarabine, while an older treatment option, is less commonly used today but can still be considered in some cases. Ganciclovir is primarily used for cytomegalovirus (CMV) infections and is not typically indicated for herpes simplex virus infections. Amantadine is an antiviral drug, but it is not effective against herpes simplex virus and is not used for herpes simplex encephalitis. Therefore, the drug that is not used in the treatment of herpes simplex encephalitis is Amantadine.
